RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DIVINE FASHION stalked three wide on the first turn then challenged into the backstretch, took the lead two deep leaving the quarter pole and was steadily handled in the lane. PRACTICALLY THERE broke a step slow then saved ground well off the early pace, started a bid nearing the seven sixteenths pole and steadily progressed to take second mid-stretch. MISS COREY rated the pace inside, was met into the backstretch and dueled from that point, gave up the nod passing the quarter pole then flattened in the lane. CASTLE OF CAYLEE settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and flattened in the lane. SHE'S ALL COURAGE stalked the early pace off the rail, challenged while between horses into the backstretch and dueled close, but dropped back at the five sixteenths pole and faded at the rail on the far turn. UNEXPECTEDLY saved ground on the first turn then eased outward into the backstretch, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn about the six path. CHRISTINE'S COSMO veered out leaving the gate and rounded the first turn in the four path, bid nearing the three eighths pole then weakened into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Practically There
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow break,saved ground,bid 7/16,steady gain for 2nd 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Christine's Cosmo
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out break,4p 1st turn,bid 3/8,weakened into far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 23000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $10,000 O r Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BRIGHT DAWN settled back in the four path the first turn, started a bid approaching the seven sixteenths pole and steadily improved in the five path of the far turn, left the turn outside, dug in to take over mid-stretch and raced clear in later yards. SPIRIT OF WINDSOR stalked off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and dug in the final furlong to take second late yards. THUNDERINREADYRICK entered the first turn five wide then angled in and took over two deep at the nine sixteenths pole, rated the pace from that point then came under pressure toward the quarter, was met inside the eighth pole and dueled through the stretch to hold third. REMYS GUNSMOKE set the pace most of the opening quarter mile then stalked from the nine sixteenths pole, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths and raced at even terms toward the head of the lane, but was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. IN JUBALATION saved ground on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, improved off the rail on the far turn but eased outward toward the head of the lane and flattened stride. SIENTE EL AMOR settled in the three path the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced near the rail on the far turn, but showed little in the lane. SPECTACULO saved ground. EXECUTIVE PRIZE was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: In Jubalation
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Thunderinreadyrick
ENTRY.OWNER: Bass Tamera L Perry William M and Perry Susan D

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 78. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR MAIDENS, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Weight, 123 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PER DIEM stalked three wide then bid toward the three eighths pole, took the lead three wide at the quarter, raced clear midway on the far turn and widened under steady stretch handling. TARAASHOQ settled off the rail the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, then dug in through the lane to take second the final yards. FANEUIL HALL stalked two deep, moved to even terms leaving the half mile pole and dueled from that point, but was caught at the quarter, rounded the far turn near the rail then flattened inside the eighth pole. SHAKIN IT BIG TIME saved ground well off the pace on the first turn, bid nearing the five sixteenths pole and raced off the rail on the far turn, then passed rivals down the lane. SHANNONRUN rounded the first turn in the four and five paths, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the three path of the far turn, eased out into the lane and showed little further. ADARA came out and made contact with BASHDAFLASH leaving the gate then settled inside, gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole but flattened stride while losing ground toward the head of the lane, while the latter was bumped early but quickly took the lead and rated the pace inside, was met into the backstretch and dueled from that point, gave up the lead at the quarter pole and weakened at the rail on the far turn. A THOUSAND IDOLS ducked out leaving the gate and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Taraashoq
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,bid 3/8,rail far turn,up 2nd final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Shakin It Big Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 5/16,off rail far turn,passed rivals

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 89. Allowance Purse 35100. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 7 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CURLIN'S MALIBU rounded the first turn in the three path, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, eased outward on the far turn and left the turn four wide, dug in from the eighth pole and got up the final strides. JUNGLE BEAST rated close inside on the opening turn, took the lead three wide at the three eighths pole, drew off from the five sixteenths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, was steadily encouraged through the lane but gave up the lead in the final strides. SANTO saved ground on the first turn, bid approaching the seven sixteenths pole, improved off the rail on the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. BE ONBOARD settled close in the three and four paths, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole then flattened in the four path of the far turn. LIKE SEGAL rated a slim early lead inside, was met leaving the nine sixteenths pole and gave chase toward the three eighths, but weakened at the rail on the far turn. BROTHER CORBIN stalked the early lead about the three path, showed little response leaving the first turn and faded past the three eighths pole. TRIKITRAKI stalked the early pace from the three path, took the lead past the nine sixteenths pole and dueled leaving the seven sixteenths, but gave up the lead at the three eighths and weakened on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Like Segal
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,met 9/16,chased 3/8,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Jungle Beast
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,up 3wd 3/8,drew off far turn,caught final strides

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 78. Claiming Purse 19400. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility)(Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Le ss Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FREEDOM RIDER was bumped leaving the gate and rounded the opening turn in the five path, started a bid passing the seven sixteenths pole, took a slim brief lead toward the five sixteenths pole, raced at a close disadvantage two deep on the far turn, recovered the lead past the eighth pole, raced clear mid-stretch and widened under steady encouragement. MANHATTAN WEAVE veered out and made contact with Freedom Rider leaving the gate then raced with the early pace off the rail, dueled from the seven sixteenths pole and contested the edge nearest the rail on the far turn, but was met past the eighth pole and relented the final sixteenth. STORMIN ROCKET stalked off the rail on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn three wide, dug in through the stretch and took third in the final yards. DANCIN IN DUBAI raced with the pace inside with a slim intermittent lead, dueled toward the three eighths pole but ceded the edge past the pole, steadied at the rail at the five sixteenths pole and faded into the far turn. FEARNOUGHT raced inside on the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, came through the far turn at the rail then flattened stride. PROUD UNION saved early ground then picked up the chase leaving the half mile pole, rounded the far turn in the five and six paths, left the turn outside and passed rivals. STRONG HEART saved ground. STRINGFELLA raced off the pace in the three and four paths on the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail then weakened. LIL TOUGHMAN was not a factor. HIDDEN ROD rounded the first turn in the three path, raced outside into the backstretch, showed no response and was eased the final quarter.

ENTRY.NAME: Dancin in Dubai
ENTRY.OWNER: Irish Hill Century Farm and McGuire Matthew

ENTRY.NAME: Proud Union
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased past 1/2,5& 6p far turn,passed rivals

ENTRY.NAME: Stormin Rocket
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,bid 3/8,3wd far turn,dueled 3rd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 77. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 29700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 7 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 7 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JAMESTOWN ROAD rated close inside on the first turn, rallied from the seven sixteenths pole and took over approaching the three eighths, raced clear toward the far turn, widened at the rail through the turn and was steadily handled in the lane. OCEAN LILLY rounded the first turn in the five path, left the turn outside and bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn but had to settle for second. GRACE ELIZABETH saved early ground, bid toward the three eighths pole, raced in the four path of the far turn and came along for third later yards. SECRET CASTLE settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the five sixteenths pole, rounded the turn in the five and six paths then flattened in the lane. CRUZ IN THE CASTLE rated a slim lead inside, was caught approaching the three eighths pole, gave chase from that point but faded at the rail on the far turn. HERETODAYGONMANANA saved ground on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. GOT YOUR NUMBER stalked off the rail into the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. MISS WAVE stalked from the four path the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole then weakened on the far turn. CHEESE LOUISE rounded the first turn in the five path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but weakened off the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Grace Elizabeth
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 3/8,4p far turn,along 3rd later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Cruz in the Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,caught near 3/8,chased,faded rail far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 73. Allowance Purse 35100. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 7 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowanc es).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUBA'S NOTION tapered in to stalk from the three path, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and took over three wide approaching the five sixteenths, drew clear past the quarter pole and was kept alert in the stretch. AREYOUGONNAKISSME rated a slim early lead but was met at even terms approaching the nine sixteenths pole, dueled from that point but dropped back at the quarter pole, dug in under steady stretch encouragement and just lasted for second. NO LOVE FOR JUBA rounded the first turn in the four path, bid leaving the three eighths pole and raced in the three path of the far turn, then just missed second while flattening late. NEVERPOPTHECORK entered the first turn in the five path and raced well back leaving the turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn four wide and showed little in the lane. XCELLENT START was bumped inward and into Pinnacle Reef leaving the gate then saved ground, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced four wide on the far turn but showed little more. LORD OF CORK ducked out at the break, rounded the first turn in the five path and showed little response. SPARKED A NOTION ducked in and made contact with Xcellent Start, raced off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole then faded in the five path of the far turn. PINNACLE REEF stumbled and was bumped shortly after the start, saved ground on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole then weakened at the rail on the far turn. COLT ROCK raced with the early pace two deep, dueled leaving the half mile pole but faded past the five sixteenths.

ENTRY.NAME: Xcellent Start
ENTRY.OWNER: Coleswood Farm, Inc. and Raim, David
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,saved ground,chased 3/8,4wd far turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Sparked a Notion
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked in,bumped break,off rail,chased 3/8,faded 5p far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Purse 34900. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since December 7 Al lowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since November 7 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: YES SIR ROBERT settled off the rail early, bid nearing the three eighths pole and took over three wide approaching the quarter pole, raced clear midway on the far turn and was steadily handled in the lane. LATE IN THE GAME settled back off the rail then eased outward on the second turn and left the turn outside, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the six path then dueled through the stretch for second. BURGEE rated close in the three and four paths, bid nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path then outfinished in the stretch duel for second. TOE TAPPIN LUKE raced with the early pace in the two and three paths then took over toward the three quarter pole, was pressured nearing the three eighths, gave up the lead approaching the quarter, dropped back midway on the far turn and flattened in the lane. STRONG LIL KOKORO raced with the pace inside then stalked from the three quarter pole, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths but faded at the rail on the far turn. SHANGHAI CANDY rounded the opening turn in the three path, saved ground on the second turn and showed little response through the backstretch. MARK DID IT rated close to the earlier pace inside then faded through the backstretch. PURPLE SHIRT rounded the first two turns in the four path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Late in the Game
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off rail,eased out 2nd turn,bid 7/16,6p far turn,duel 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Mark Did It
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 9 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JULY 7, 2022. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In E ligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ONE MORE FACTOR stalked in the four path the first turn then picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, dueled for the lead three wide approaching the top of the stretch and dug in determinedly to inch further ahead in late yards. BETTER BOOGIE stalked two deep into the first turn, took the nod past the half mile pole and showed the way from that point, came under pressure at the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and was met leaving the turn, but dueled through the stretch for second. SUGAR DADDY took the lead at the rail into the first turn and rated the pace, was met into the backstretch and dueled leaving the three eighths pole, contested at a close disadvantage nearest the rail on the far turn then outfinished in the stretch duel for second. FRANKEE MERCH saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, eased out through the upper stretch and finished well. I SEE THE STARS rated close off the rail on the opening turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole and raced off the rail on the far turn, entered the stretch four wide then flattened late. INTERNET OF THINGS raced off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole but weakened off the rail on the far turn. SUNMAN was carried out into the first turn and never factored. HALO'S DANCE bore out into the first turn and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Frankee Merch
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,rail far turn,eased out 1/8,finish well

ENTRY.NAME: I See the Stars
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,bid 3/8,off rail far turn,4wd 1/8,flattened late

ENTRY.NAME: Halo's Dance
ENTRY.COMMENT: bore out into 1st turn, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Sunman
ENTRY.COMMENT: carried out into 1st turn, never factored
